newsitem.title: USA: NY precious metals called to open mixed.
newsitem.headline: NY precious metals called to open mixed.

text.p: COMEX and NYMEX precious metals futures were called to open mixed Tuesday, with the pressure remaining on gold and silver as the dollar firmed against most major currencies for a third session overnight.
Meanwhile platinum group metals (PGMs) were expected to open higher after Russia failed to meet another self-imposed deadline for resuming exports.
COMEX August gold was called unchanged to off $0.30 from Monday's close of $335.30 an ounce after trading from $335.40 to $334.60 on ACCESS.
In the bullion market, spot gold was quoted at $333.80/$334.30 early against the London morning fix of $333.60 - a fresh four-year low. In New York Monday, spot gold ended quoted at $333.70/$334.20.

Commodity fund selling accelerated last week as the four year low at $336.00, seen in January this year, came under pressure again, while Australian gold miners took advantage of a slide in the Australian dollar to hedge their positions by selling more gold forward, bullion dealers said.
COMEX gold stocks were unchanged at 844,994 ounces Tuesday, while COMEX silver stocks rose 215,492 ounces to 185,528,996 ounces.
COMEX September silver was called unchanged to up 0.50 cent from Monday's close of $4.648 after trading between $4.680 and $4.650 on ACCESS.
NYMEX October platinum was called up $2.00 to $3.00 from the previous close of $412.80, with NYMEX September palladium expected to open up $1.00 to $2.00 from $174.90 yesterday.
